paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper reports a pathogenic variant in the KCNH2 gene associated with long QT syndrome, including details on penetrance and individual cases.

patients.demographics: 1 female proband (newborn), 1 mother (30 years old), 1 sibling (newborn)
patients.phenotype: Long QT syndrome (LQTS) with episodes of ventricular tachycardia

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Postnatal telemetry monitoring identified 3 brief episodes of ventricular tachycardia.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Benign clinical history, longest QTc measured at 456 ms
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The mother’s initial clinical history and ECG were benign, with the longest QTc measured at 456 ms.

individual_records.phenotype_details: QTc significantly prolonged at 634 ms, intermittent 2:1 AV block
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Following delivery, telemetry revealed intermittent 2:1 AV block alternating with 1:1 AV conduction.

functional_data.summary: The variant alters an amino acid that localizes to the pore helix of the HERG channel, critical for ion permeation.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the proband and sibling.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and literature.
variants.additional_notes: The mother showed signs of possible mosaicism with a lower than expected read ratio for the variant.
key_quotes: This variant alters an amino acid that localizes to the pore helix of the HERG channel, a region critical for ion permeation.
The mosaic nature of the mother is apparent by the low number of mutant nucleotides at this site.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
